intro: Teucrium nablii, commonly known as the Moroccan germander, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, which is characterized by square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with small, tubular flowers that range in color from purple to pink. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a fragrant, mint-like aroma. Teucrium nablii is often found in rocky or arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils.
